tr.td: The accreditation number needs to be utilised for certifying learners on qualification(s)/ skills programme(s)/ unit standard(s) for which programme approval has been awarded.
The facilitator must be a registered assessor and/ or moderator.
Assessor and Moderators awaiting registration cannot conduct assessments and moderation.
Learner PoEs to be kept for a minimum of 5 years.
Custodian of Policy: Executive Manager : ETQA

Site: Head Office or Satellite
Office?
Geographic distribution of business, branches,training sites

Training Provider Representative
(if different from above)

div.h3: SECTION 2: Areas for remediation addressed by the provider from the previous verification visit

tr.th: Items of the Previous Developmental Plan
List the Qualification(s) / Learning Programme(s) /Skills Programme(s) TO BE VERIFIED for which the Provider has programme approval from the HWSETA ETQA

tr.td: Is the Learning Programme Approval letter available? If yes, a copy of each to be supplied.
Is the Learning Programme Approval report available? If yes, a copy of each to be supplied.
Is the Accreditation letter available? If yes, a copy of each to be supplied.

div.h3: The learner matrix must highlight the above that indicate the category the learner falls within.
SECTION 5: Learner Details/ Assessor Details/ Moderator Details

tr.td:
NB. The HWSETA official should verify that the
assessment date captured in the verification
report is the same as the assessment date

div.h3: 5.2 Assessor Details linked to the Verified learners
(Only the details of the ETD practitioners involved in the learner achievements being verified should be captured)

tr.td: Does the Provider have the following documents available and in place?
Signed Contract with the registered assessor(s)
Code of conduct for assessor(s), signed by both Provider and assessor(s)

div.h3: 5.3 Moderator Details linked to verified learners
(Only the details of the ETD practitioners involved in the earner achievements being verified should be captured)

tr.td: Does the Provider have the following documents available and in place?
Signed Contract with the registered moderator(s)
Code of conduct for assessor(s), signed by both Provider and moderator(s)
Copy of relevant learning programme’s Qualification(s) and /or Unit Standard(s)
Start and end date of training correlates with the Qualification and /or Unit Standard/s
Evidence Matrix indicating where and how Specific Outcomes, Assessment Criteria, Critical Cross-Field Outcomes are addressed
Matrix showing learner achievement against each US (HWSETA template)
Assessor’s and moderator’s proof of registration with HWSETA on the learning programme being verified including latest comprehensive Curriculum Vitae

div.h3: The Officer must verify that all policies below are available and have been implemented practically during the deliverance of the learning programme. Where amendments have been made to a particular policy, evidence must be provided indicating the amendment and implementation.

tr.th: Does the Provider have the following available and in place?

tr.td: Learning Programme design, development, delivery and evaluation Policy and Procedures
Policy and procedure in place to provide guidance regarding the developing and designing of outcomes-based learning material in accordance with SAQA and ETQA Policy and guidelines.
Assessment Instruments and Tools that clearly indicate SOs, ACs and CCFOs covered

Policy and Procedure in place that ensure Principles of Assessment are adhered to ensure credibility and authenticity of assessments. Should include an Appeals procedure which outlines grounds for appealing against assessment or moderation outcome.

Policy and Procedure in place that ensure Principles of Assessment are adhered to ensure credibility and authenticity of assessments. Should include an Appeals procedure which outlines or moderation outcome.

Policy and Procedure in place that ensure Principles of Assessment are adhered to ensure credibility and authenticity of assessments. Should include an Appeals procedure which outlines grounds for appealing against assessment
Learner Entry, Guidance and Support Policy and Procedure
Policy and procedure in place to provide clear guidelines for learner entry, guidance and support and to include learners with disability and special learning needs.
RPL Policy and procedures to ensure that learners experiential learning enables them to access learning and / are awarded credits for their demonstrated prior learning.
(policy should articulate the role of the provider and HWSETA, stipulate the learner upload)
Policy and Procedure in place that ensure Process of printing and outlines or security measures.
Policy and Procedure in place that ensure re assessment is conducted
Policy and Procedure in place that ensure all irregularities are handled and learners know about those

div.h3: SECTION 8: Learning Programme Design, Development, Delivery and Evaluation
(NB. Focus should only be on the programme being verified)

tr.th: Does the Provider have the following available and in place?

tr.td: The officers must ensure that the guides have addressed the following aspects:
Clear instructions to the assessor and learner
Valid and appropriate assessment methods, assessment criteria and tools with detailed scoring criteria and record sheets
Assessment plan prepared along with the HWSETA quality guidelines
Time frames and location of assessment
Coverage of unit standards, skills programme and/ or qualifications on which the LP is based.
How practical, foundational and reflective competences will be assessed?
How applied competence will be assessed in an integrated assessment
How Critical Cross Field Outcomes will be assessed?
Clear instructions to the moderator and assessor
Valid and acceptable sampling of assessment criterion (e.g. 10 % of 50 learners)
Moderation plan prepared along with the HWSETA quality guideline and is based on the assessment plan for the learning programme being moderated
Covers all moderation cycles (Pre-, during and post assessment phases).

div.h3: SECTION 9: Reporting of Learner Achievements, Certification and Usage of HWSETA Logo

tr.th: Reporting of Learner Achievements, Certification and Usage of HWSETA Logo

tr.td: Does the provider have access to the SMS? If yes, details (Name and ID number) of the relevant person(s) to be provided.
Are learners uploaded and the learner achievements linked on the SMS?
Unit standard(s)/Skills programme based training – Has provider downloaded the Statement of Results (SOR) from the SMS?
Is the endorsement letter(s) received from HWSETA available?
Full qualification(s) based training – Are certificates issued to learners? If yes, the following must be available: copies of Certificates and certification register.
Assessment plan prepared along with the Principles of assessment
The assessment plan reflects time frames and location of assessment
How practical, foundational and reflective competences will be assessed?
How applied competence will be assessed in an integrated assessment?
Is RPL purpose, process and practice clearly articulated?
How Critical Cross Field Outcomes will be assessed?
Are assessments conducted as per the training provider’s Assessment Plan and Guide?
Were the candidates adequately prepared for the assessment?
Were the candidates informed of their right to appeal and the procedure to follow?
Does the trainer provider have support mechanisms for special needs e.g. language barriers?
Are all formative and summative assessments assessed?
Are the Qualification rules of combination applied correctly? (full qualification only)
Is there an assessor report per candidate?
Is there an overall assessment report?
Is the moderation plan prepared along with the moderation principles?
Does the moderation plan reflect the time and location of the moderation?
Does the plan cover the entire moderation cycle? (Pre-, during and post assessment phase).
Does the plan cover what is to be moderated?
Is moderation conducted as per the training provider’s Moderation Plan and Guide?
Is evidence of meetings and communication between assessor and moderator available?
Is there evidence that the policies, guides (learner, facilitator, assessment and moderation), formative assessment, summative assessment and plans have been moderated?
Is there evidence that the Moderator has compared his/her judgement with that of the assessor?
Is there a moderation report per candidate?
Is there a comprehensive moderation report outlining the strengths and weaknesses of the assessor?

Did the moderator make recommendations on how to improve the assessment and moderation process as well as the Quality Management System, Guides, Assessment Instruments and Tools and Learning Programme?
Is feedback given to and signed by the assessor
Is feedback given to and signed by the moderator
Is there a feedback report on the NQF?
Qualification, Skills programmes and/or Unit Standard
Is the PoE organised logically according to the Table of Content?
Is there a completed HWSETA Learner Information form in the PoE?
CV and certified copies of qualification/ Certificate
Originally certified copy of the learner ID
Is there a signed Learner Declaration of Authenticity form?
Is there evidence of Formative Assessments in the PoE?
Is there an acknowledgement checklist signed by the learner in the PoE?

Workplace agreement signed by both the provider and employer
Comment:
Is there a designated mentor assigned to the learner?
Are learners provided with Assessment Instruments/ Logbook/ Workbook to be completed at the Workplace?
Learner Workbook signed by mentor and learner
Does the mentor provide the facilitator with feedback reports?
Are learners providing feedback to mentors on their workplace experience?
Date by which the activity will be done
Areas for remediation addressed by the provider from the previous visit
Extension of Scope to Other ETQAs
Learning Programme design, development, delivery and evaluation Policy and Procedures
Learner Entry, Guidance and Support Policy and Procedures
Learning Programme Design, Development,Delivery and Evaluation
Assessment Guide including Assessment Instruments and Tools

div.h3: Due date for submission of required/ outstanding documents:
NB: failure to submit all the outstanding documents and the minimum requirements are not met to No Status will be awarded/ No Learner Certificates will be printed (Provider/ HWSETA).
Non Negotiable matters constitute no endorsements until such time all matters are completed by the agreed deadline and is referred to as the conditions for endorsement.

tr.th:
Recommendation/ Comments
(List the Non negotiable matters)

div.h3: SECTION 15: Endorsement of Learner Achievements – Management approval

tr.td: Controlled and checked by the provincial Manager

div.h3: Please complete the table below to authenticate the aforementioned information in relation to the findings of the visit. Please take note that the information that you will provide below will serve as the agreement between the HWSETA Representative(s) and the Training Provider Representative(s) on the contents of this “Report”.
